question: Under which of the following, the power of the Supreme Court of India to decide disputes between the Centre and the State falls?
explanation: The Article 131 of the Indian Constitution deals with the original jurisdiction of the Supreme Court of India. The Supreme Court has original jurisdiction in disputes between the Centre and one or more states; or between the Centre and any state or states on one side and one or more other states on the other side; or between two or more states.
